alert.note: Alert for Cochran; Yoakum (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 4:27PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Cochran and north central Yoakum Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 426 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Bledsoe, or 20 miles southwest of Morton, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Brief funnel clouds are possible with this storm. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects and vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Cochran and north central Yoakum Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
